short_description: Discover Cameroon, a Central African nation known as 'Africa in Miniature' for its incredible diversity. Experience diverse landscapes from rainforests to savannas, explore wildlife-rich national parks, discover vibrant cultures, and immerse yourself in the warm hospitality of the Cameroonian people.

health.tap_water_safety: Not safe to drink - bottled or filtered water is recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Cameroon has diverse climates ranging from tropical along the coast to semi-arid in the north. The country experiences two distinct seasons: a dry season from November to April and a wet season from May to October, with regional variations.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Cooler and drier weather, making this the best time to visit. Perfect for wildlife viewing in national parks, hiking Mount Cameroon, and exploring cities. Ideal conditions for outdoor activities and safaris

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Transition periods with occasional rain showers. Still manageable for travel, but be prepared for some rainfall. Good time to visit before or after the peak dry season

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall and high humidity, especially in the south. Challenging conditions for travel, with flooding possible in some areas. Lush green landscapes but difficult for outdoor activities

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Cameroon is during the dry season from November to April when the weather is cooler and drier, making it ideal for wildlife viewing in national parks, hiking Mount Cameroon, and exploring cities
